SENT.plain: A 38-year-old woman with systemic lupus erythematosus and the phospholipid antibody syndrome was admitted because of rapidly evolving symptoms consistent with a transverse myelopathy at the TH9/10 level
Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) showed slight diffuse swelling and increased signal intensity of the spinal cord
She was treated with high dose methylprednisolone plus azathioprine and aspirin
Four months later she had achieved almost complete remission with minimal residual sphincter disturbances
Despite the clinical recovery, repeated MRI at 4 months and 4 years showed diffuse and irreversible atrophy of the entire spinal cord
